contents.title: ## Introduction
contents.text:
This report summarizes the results of public input, encompassing:
 * __3 statements__
 * __37 votes__
 * 1 topics
 * 2 subtopics

All voters were anonymous.

contents.title: ## Overview
contents.text:
Below is a high level overview of the topics discussed in the conversation, as well as the percentage of statements categorized under each topic. Note that the percentages may add up to greater than 100% when statements fall under more than one topic.

* **Minimum Wage (100%):** The conversation explored the potential impacts of a £15 minimum wage, with some statements advocating for the increase and others citing research suggesting minimal effects on job growth.  The broader economic implications were also a point of discussion.

contents.title: ## Top 2 Most Discussed Subtopics
contents.text: 2 subtopics of discussion emerged. These 2 subtopics had the most statements submitted.

subContents.title: Prominent themes were:
subContents.text:
* Minimum wage impact on jobs
* Job growth and wages
* Economic effects of policy
* Living wage debates
* Employment levels

subContents.title: Prominent themes were:
subContents.text:
* Negative impact on small businesses
* Localized economic effects
* Harm to specific sectors
* Financial losses
* Business instability

contents.title: ## Topics
contents.text: From the statements submitted, 1 high level topics were identified, as well as 2 subtopics. Based on voting patterns both points of common ground as well as differences of opinion have been identified and are described below.

subContents.title: ### Minimum Wage (3 statements)
subContents.text: This topic included 1 subtopic, comprising a total of 3 statements.

subContents.title: #### Job Growth (2 statements)
subContents.text: This subtopic had high alignment compared to the other subtopics.

subContents.title: Prominent themes were:
subContents.text:
* **Minimum Wage Increase**: Some statements propose raising the minimum wage to £15.
* **Impact on Employment**:  Other statements mention studies suggesting a modest impact on jobs from minimum wage increases.

subContents.title: Common ground:
subContents.text: No statements met the thresholds necessary to be considered as a point of common ground (at least 20 votes, and at least 70% agreement).

subContents.title: Differences of opinion:
subContents.text: No statements met the thresholds necessary to be considered as a significant difference of opinion (at least 20 votes, and both an agreement rate and disagree rate between 40%% and 60%%).

comments.text: I think we should raise the minimum wage to £15.
That will hurt small businesses in Brighton.
Studies show only a modest impact on jobs.
